3. For 'cabling redundancy', check if they both have the same option or not. Here, 'Ethernet Powerlink' has 'no', and 'Ethernet/IP' also has 'no'. So, they are the same for this field.

4. For 'synchronisation', check if they both have 'yes', 'no', or different options. In this case, neither have 'yes', so they are the same for this field.

5. For 'sub millisecond cycle', check if 'Ethernet Powerlink' has 'yes' and 'Ethernet/IP' does not. Here, 'Ethernet Powerlink' has 'yes' and 'Ethernet/IP' does not. So, they are different for this field.

6. Based on the comparison of all fields, the claim states that these two should be the same except for the 'sub millisecond cycle'. Our findings match this condition, as they are the same for all fields except 'sub millisecond cycle'.
